Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.gameElements

Class GameScene

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Subject
com.example.demo.gameElements.GameScene
public class GameScene extends Subject
This class is the main class for all operations that shall be orchestrated within the game scene (i.e. calling the correct class and the correct method at the appropriate time) to ensure all functions as intended when the user is playing through the game. Mainly the what, how and the order in which the elements shall appear in will be determined here.The class is instantiated whenever the user has made a choice in their mode that they wish to play.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScene

      public GameScene()
      Constructor for the GameScene class. When instantiated, the class shall create instances of the following classes, textMaker, gameVisuals, stateChecker and movement. Reason being that these classes hold the methods that are key to the success of the operations within the gameScene. Class itself is instantiated in the modeSelectSceneController after the user has selected their mode of choice.

  • Method Details

    • getN

      public static int getN()
      method that returns the dimensions that was chosen by the user. Used in utility classes to check the boundaries of the game.
      Returns:
      The dimension of the playing field.

    • setN

      public static void setN(int number)
      Method used in setting the dimensions of the playing field (tiles). Used when the user has made a choice in the choice box in the mode selection screen. Always defaults to 4 when the user has made no choice (not determined by this specific method). Method also calculates the exact length of the cells. Length (one side) of the cell is also set as the length of each cell varies from dimension to dimension.
      Parameters:
      number - the dimensions (number x number) in which the tiles will set in.

    • getLENGTH

      public static double getLENGTH()
      Method that returns the length of one side of a single cell. Value is never constant for each mode, therefore it is important for the utility functions to be up-to-date with the exact measurements.
      Returns:
      the length of one side of one cell in pixels.

    • game

      public void game(javafx.scene.Scene gameScene, javafx.scene.Group root, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, javafx.scene.Scene endGameScene, javafx.scene.Group endGameRoot)
      Generally the method is employed as an initializer and a controller. The responsibilities of the class includes determining the position of the playing space, the order in which the elements appear in, calling the correct methods from other classes for movement related activities and shall also detect the instance when the user has lost or won and act accordingly to the situation. Method mainly utilizes all the utility methods from the utility package in order to achieve a coherent experience.
      Parameters:
      gameScene - The scene that shall be filled with the correct elements in the correct order by the method.
      root - cluster of elements that shall appear in the game scene. Will be filled by the method.
      primaryStage - the stage in which all scenes play out and is the main window for the game.
      endGameScene - The endgame Scene for the game, used to instantiate the end game scene when user wins or losses.
      endGameRoot - The endgame Group for the game, used to instantiate the elements in the end game when user wins or losses.
